Little does Clark know, Batman isn't nearly as opposed as he seems and Batman might have a secret of his own to share.Too bad everything goes wrong as soon as Batman starts to open up. entry.title: so will i
entry.summary:
Author: maemimi

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 21,150Chapters: 6/7Kudos: 86

Summary: Superman gets used to fighting alongside Batman. Strategies unmatched and a wide set of knowledge about most necessary matters encountered in the bat’s path have put the man of steel’s rather stylized way of fighting in a more tranquil stance ever since they ever decided to join forces. They evolved into neat partners, able to perfectly comprehend their battlefield needs, and their personal ones too, never threading paths too far from one another even in their different areas– meaning, both geographically and morally.  And maybe that's why Clark's heart sank when he met Robin, scared, looking way too small in a cape and suit too big for him, eyes sparkling through his need to fight and to prove himself fit for the size of a hero the world needs him to be. Bold were his moves, and his ecstatic urge to live despite the pain he felt with every punch he received, just a few seconds before getting up again and dodging every next one.

entry.title: And you can quote me on that
entry.summary:
Author: maruja35

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,170Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 30

Summary: In a deviation from expectations, Clark and Bruce meet for the first time not as Superman and Batman, and not as reporter and billionaire business owner, but as some version of themselves somewhere in the middle of all their respective identities.Clark nods, pushes his glasses back into place, smiles. It's sweet. It's comfortable. Bruce feels a sense of peace — there's no need to rush this. He steals one last kiss, then walks back to his car.He remembers to text Clark later, when he's back at the manor and before patrol, letting him know he made it home safe and wishing him a good night.He sees Clark again, unplanned, unexpected, Saturday night.OrAfter the Rift, Clark keeps moving. He's a bit lonely, a bit less trusted than he was before, a bit optimistic about a budding new friendship - relationship? He's determined not to mess things up, but he will. Things never work out just right. Meanwhile, Bruce throws caution to the wind and lets someone in for a change. He thinks it's fine, until he makes eye contact with him from across the room and feels the cool knife of betrayal slide between his ribs. It only gets more complicated from there.

entry.title: Getting Over You With You
entry.summary:
Author: Anonymous

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 20,763Chapters: 6/15Kudos: 37

Summary: Bruce Wayne has always been careful—about business, about Gotham, and especially about people. That is, until he meets Clark Kent. Sharp, earnest, and unflinchingly curious, Clark isn’t just another reporter looking for a story—he’s the kind of person Bruce finds impossible to ignore. But there’s a complication: Clark Kent is in love with someone else. Someone who wears a mask, prowls the shadows, and doesn’t exist in the daylight world Clark inhabits. Bruce watches, patiently, navigating the line between desire and discretion, as Clark wrestles with his feelings for the Dark Knight. As they grow closer—through follow-up interviews, quiet conversations, and tentative dates—Clark begins to confront what he truly wants, and Bruce begins to realize just how much he’s willing to risk for someone who doesn’t even know he exists outside the mask (the mask that is Bruce Wayne).
